title: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf - Wikipedia
snippet: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf (born c. 1956; Arabic: أحمد عوض بن عوف‎) is a Sudanese military officer and politician who served as the de facto head of state for one day from 11 April 2019 to 12 April 2019 after taking part in the 2019 Sudanese coup d'état.

title: Sudan coup leader Awad Ibn Auf steps down
snippet: Defence Minister Awad Ibn Auf announced his decision on state TV, naming as his successor Lt-Gen Abdel Fattah Abdelrahman Burhan.

title: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf | Historica Wiki | Fandom
snippet: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf (1957-) was the head of the Transitional Military Council of Sudan from 11 to 12 April 2019, succeeding Omar al-Bashir and preceding Abdel Fattah Abdelrahman Burhan.
